{"blocks":[{"key":"9qml6","text":"Using a sterile inoculation loop, select a single colony from your bacteria streaked LB agar plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36b3c","text":"Dip the inoculation loop into the liquid LB and swirl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v4vj","text":"Discard the inoculation loop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ets20","text":"Loosely cover the culture with sterile aluminium foil or a cap that is not air tight as bacteria needs air.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fs0c","text":"Incubate the bacterial culture at the required growth temperature overnight (i.e. 12-18 hrs in general) in a shaking incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qs89","text":"After incubation, check for growth, which is characterized by a cloudy haze in the media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lfjb","text":"Measure the optical density of the bacterial culture at 600nm wavelength using a spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8pct0","text":"Record the OD600 three times and calculate average, use LB Broth as Blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

36417.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32sek","text":"Obtain LB Broth from the Media kitchen ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1drvd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2460o","text":"LB Broth contents: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dnebh","text":"4gNaCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"v0f3","text":"4 g Tryptone","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3i257","text":"2 g Yeast Extract ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"au4dc","text":"Add dH2O to 400 mL ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80emj","text":"Wipe the work area with 70% ethanol and create a relatively sterile environment on the laboratory bench by using a simple gas-powered burner. Work under the hood if you have a large number of plates. Book the hood in advance in that case","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2viqr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ltgj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"12l7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"baa2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"biam4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nqq5","text":"Label the inoculation plates and the lids with the corresponding frozen library plate ID","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3j252","text":"Add 200ul liquid LB to each well of the 96-well plate using a multichannel pipette and a sterile reservoir. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6jvfd","text":"Details of the plates used:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7re9c","text":"Name- Nunc MicroWell Plates with Nunclon Delta Surface-C (ThermoFisher Scientific)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"16ri8","text":"Catalogue number- 143761","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ehek","text":"Well capacity- 300ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f7t37","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aamfg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2g1p7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60pmi","text":"Take the frozen library plates out of the freezer just before doing the inoculation to avoid the wells thawing completely (We want to avoid repetitive freeze thawing of the bacterial strains). You can also use dry ice to take all the plates out of the freezer at once. In that case, just before inoculation take the respective plate off the dry ice and leave at bench top for 2mins","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fv62","text":"Position the plates so that well A1 of every plate is at the top left. You can also put sticker on the replicator to mark A1 and H12, to avoid confusion and contamination","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kcqt","text":"To use the replicator, strap some laboratory/masking tape around your index and middle finger together with the adhesive part on the outer side. Use the stickiness of the tape to pick the replicator by gently pressing on the surface ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7eudg","text":"Insert the sterile replicator into the frozen library plate (make sure to touch the surface or puncture into the frozen wells to obtain sufficient bacterial cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8edjj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"68stk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"brlem","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2cbv3","text":"Dip the replicator into the inoculation plate with the LB broth (try to swirl the replicator slightly while inside the wells to ensure some bacteria has mixed with the liquid LB)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67qdn","text":"Put the replicator inside the autoclavable box to be sterilised for later use (Try to use one replicator for every inoculation plate to avoid contamination)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6elre","text":"Cover the inoculation plates with plastic lids and/or breathable seals (Axygen Rayon breathable film sterile 50um, Catalogue number-AXY2008)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qnjm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"anhou","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bfkcl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8cni3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"783um","text":"If the plates are not intended to be shaken then place them in an airtight box and put inside the incubator to avoid uneven evaporation of the LB and the wells drying up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8h2ji","text":"Incubate the bacterial culture at the required growth temperature overnight (i.e. 12-18 hrs in general) with/without shaking depending on the growth conditions of the bacterial strains (If shaking is required at any temperature other than 37C, make sure to book the shaking incubator in advance)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ao67","text":"Also, if the plates are meant to be shaken, make sure the wells have a maximum of 2/3 volume of their capacity (i.e. For wells with 300ul capacity do not exceed the volume of 200ul) Shaking rpm should be between 150-180rpm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8nsd","text":"After incubation, check for growth, which is characterized by a cloudy haze in the media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2r2kp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"23qtv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

42691.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"33vs9","text":"Prepare a 250ml bottle of hot milliQ water in the microwave and keep in the waterbath along with the agar. The water is important to have on hand in case of tubing blockages.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"51doc","text":"Insert large cassette into the machine ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m0e7","text":"Configure X, Y, and Z settings for the multiwell plate by clicking on tool symbol -\u003e stage alignment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"161a0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"54ihu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ekfnd","text":"For UNIPLATE96SQWLF 650U:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ka4l","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b3cpf","text":"X = 95.6","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1t6n","text":"Y = 4.2","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1c5oj","text":"Z = -22.5","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cimvt","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ao756","text":"For 48WP:","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vkc8","text":"Put the plate into the stage and then press 'Move' so that the plate moves so that it is under the dispensing cassette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8cum","text":"Use the up and down arrows to move the pipette tip so that they hover just over the plate and make note of the height (this will be entered into the dispensing program at a later step). Press 'Fast/Slow' button to switch between fast and slow movements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjhcv","text":"Use the X, Y arrows to move the plate so that the pipette tips are centered in the middle of column 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp8b9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cqqpg","text":"Save all settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"408bt","text":"Exit settings by pressing the back button","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed30p","text":"Press on the program you wish to use (see later for configuring your own program)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"devtr","text":"Make sure that the correct cassette is listed and change if necessary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jpm6","text":"Select the volume you wish to dispense","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"urjb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"11hld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9a5eh","text":"For 96WP:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53qop","text":"200 μL","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5gusm","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5i8r","text":"Select 'set height' and set the appropriate height for tip height (usually all the same)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3cuh","text":"Place the end of the tubing from the casettee into the agar that is being kept warm in the water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5shbd","text":"Press 'Prime' to prime the tubing and allow to finish so that agar flows from the pipette tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ers0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eflmm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qvfo","text":"IMPORTANT:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"j6hg","text":"Once the agar is in the tubing it is important to act quickly to avoid agar solidifying and causing blockages. If you are particularly concerned about agar cooling in the tubing, wrap the tubing in aluminium foil to keep hot.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

cases.title: Unblocking the tubing
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5j1a2","text":"If the tubing does block, clear the blockage by 'reverse priming' as much of the agar as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dpkc","text":"Then place tube ends in the hot water and prime continuously with hot water until the water runs all the way through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b05rb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceof","text":"If you are having trouble getting the water through, squeeze and massage parts of the tubing where you can see blockages to force the agar along and allow the water to pass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5sme","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r489","text":"Once all cleared, 'reverse prime', and reprime with the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

42691.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"86cme","text":"Place a clean plate in the stage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ej3s","text":"Press run and then plate should fill with agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9o0bu","text":"Repeat steps 11-12 until all the plates have been filled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97j18","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"25sir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c4eh","text":"Little drops of agar can solidify on the tip ends. It is often good to remove these drops using a pipette tip every few runs so that blockages do not occur. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"83lh","text":"'Reverse prime' all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1tkvv","text":"Place the tubing ends into the hot water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2qk6v","text":"Prime so that the water runs through and clears all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fhse3","text":"Reverse prime to remove the water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7dvv5","text":"Release tension from the tubing and remove cassette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8vp46","text":"Double wrap the cassette in aluminium foil for autoclaving","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

47321.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"309bv","text":" Book the autoclave (notebook on top of the machine).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8jj73","text":" Take clean flasks from the glass kitchen.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1djq8","text":" Measure all the pre-autoclave reagents and add to the flask (Use a new weighing boat and spatula for each reagent. Also, the cholesterol is kept in the fridge.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"du0k","text":" Once water is added mix thoroughly and label with autoclave tape (‘NGM Rm 5020’). Make sure the bottle is not screwed completely when placing it inside the autoclave machine.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d1upm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n4ll","text":"     - Turn ON the autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hcii","text":"     - Make sure that the autoclave’s probe bottle is the same size as the largest bottle you use and fill it with water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6m9aj","text":"     - Place the temperature probe in it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64o03","text":"     - Fill up the autoclave with water until it reaches the grill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2tak","text":"     - Place the bottles in the autoclave and make sure that the cap is not screwed completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"15kuc","text":"     - Check the waste flask is not too full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f30mb","text":"     - Use ‘media’ program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3da1n","text":"     - Press START.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9b3ll","text":"     - It will take about 2 hours for a 500ml bottle to autoclave and about 2.5 hours for 1L or larger bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3or95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do41r","text":" When autoclave is complete, remove the probe flask ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f79r","text":" Make sure to wear gloves as the flask will be hot","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe27u","text":" Let the agar to cool to around 55°C, ie the bottle is cool enough to hold for a second with a gloved hand.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rb6n","text":" Add the post autoclave reagents.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iou4","text":" Mix it well and start pouring onto imaging plates following the Protocol for Plate Pouring.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qt0f","text":"Try not to shake the bottle too much while mixing to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v7q2","text":"The agar needs to be warm to be poured without blocking the tubings, so try to pour as quickly as possible and if not poured immediately put the bottle on a waterbath set to 60C until being used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

47335.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1usv2","text":"Leave the Falcon tube to stand for a while until the worm settle to the bottom in a loose pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2av71","text":"Add 350μL bleach mix to the 2mL solution of worms in M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jfp0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"qmhk","text":"Wash worms off the plates with a few mL of M9 buffer into a 15mL Falcon tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mps2","text":"Mix together in an Eppendorf tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3cn9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ep24","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fj5uv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"0DDD5530709111EB96968141F1145020","id":0,"label":"NaOH [4M]","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"350","error":false,"guid":"1D01FB10709111EB96968141F1145020","id":0,"label":"Sodium Hypochlorite [Acros Organics, 10/15% active chlorine, 7681-52-9]","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p10d","text":"Remove the supernatant leaving 2mL M9 solution in the tube (with the worms pelleted)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj7qo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1ufj","text":"Vortex for 5 min (checking every 30 seconds under a microscope to see if the worms are broken apart and eggs have been released).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar6md","text":"Once the majority of eggs have been released, quench the solution by topping up the Falcon tube to 14mL with M9. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cr54","text":"Centrifuge at 6700 rpm for 2 minutes to pellet the eggs to the bottom.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dcs42","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant using a plastic Pasteur pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"124sm","text":"Top up the Falcon tube to 14mL with M9. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae79f","text":"Repeat Steps 8 - 10 three more times, to thoroughly quench the bleach solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fsnp","text":"After the final wash, top up to 10mL with M9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kauh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b51gg","text":"The next morning, transfer the newly hatched L1 larvae in 10mL M9 solution to a sterile conical Eppendorf tube using a glass Pasteur pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ohav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kf64","text":"Pipette the 10mL solution onto an empty 60mm plate using a glass Pasteur pipette, and incubate at 20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6c65h","text":"Using a glass Pasteur pipette, remove as much supernatant as possible, and then pool all L1 worms together into a single Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lpds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjfek","text":"Dispense 3μL of L1 solution on the lid of a 60mm Petri plate, and count under microscope how many worms are in the droplet. Use this to estimate the total worm concentration of the Eppendorf. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"obo6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21sm7","text":"Using a DISTRIMAN Gilson repetitive pipette, dispense approximately 500 worms onto each plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mchf","text":"NB: The concentration may be adjusted by re-centrifuging and removing less supernatant with the Pasteur pipette (to dilute the solution if needed), and re-counting the number of worms in 3μL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

50531.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"av8j1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4d1lk","text":" Turn on the compressor at the wall – it should show a pressure of 40psi after switched on","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ftkhd","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1nvjl","text":"Turn on equipment in the following order","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"527md","text":"a.Sorter (left side of unit near bottom)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f4apc","text":"b.Computer and monitor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2in5f","text":"c.Laser, located under computer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6u4kv","text":"d.Vacuum pump (switch on wall to right of sorter)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"1C321D1EC76E11EB90790A58A9FEAC02","height":"291","is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":null,"source":null,"width":"598"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"589A0170C76E11EB9EEE05DF744365A3","height":301,"id":114487,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2021-06-07 at 09.56.24.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr33bipyx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr3zbipyx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr32bipyx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr3ybipyx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8fgqq","text":"Discard waste contents that are in the recovery cup (small shallow cup on the left-hand side of the machine)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1jd0","text":"a.Check/clean the recovery cup filter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdm7h","text":"b.Replace filter ~once per week with a new cell strainer (it should clip into place)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6h9u","text":"Check that there is water in the sheath. If the water is low (less than 5cm above the top of the green sensor), fill up withsterile H2O (from 4thfloor kitchen)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":124,"length":35},{"style":"sub","offset":133,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":143,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"828es","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rjm3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"276oj","text":"Make sure that the recovery cup and sample cup are securely tightened so that there are no leaks in the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7btqh","text":"Check that there is sterile water in the sample cup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pp98","text":"Check for stray plate lids etc in the area around the COPAS stage and remove","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"332j6","text":"Open dbgview – should always be running in the background","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4qjh","text":"Open FlowPilot software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"88eko","text":"a.File -\u003e Load Experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bvadt","text":"i.Select appropriate template experiment from Documents/BehaviouralGenomics (adults, L4s, L2s all have different gates set)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6caaa","text":"b.File -\u003e Load sample (will load the sample with the appropriate gate for your experiments)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1j5h4","text":"Save your experiment for this day of sorting (YYYYMMDD_experimentname)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dobef","text":"Save sample (adults/L4s etc)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"vkmv","text":"Check that the pressures are all okay (bottom left of software screen):","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3kdhn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2arf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"246fm","text":"CompartmentPressure (psi)Sheath~2.6Sample cup~1.6Diverter6Cleaning4","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":67}],"data":[]},{"key":"emcvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"20ata","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[126,99],"data":[["\u003cb\u003eCompartment\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003ePressure (psi)\u003c/b\u003e"],["Sheath","~2.6"],["Sample cup","~1.6"],["Diverter","6"],["Cleaning","4"]],"guid":"E93C3535C76E11EB90790A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["\u003cb\u003eCompartment\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003ePressure (psi)\u003c/b\u003e"],["Sheath","~2.6"],["Sample cup","~1.6"],["Diverter","6"],["Cleaning","4"]],"rowHeights":[]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cb4ag","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flush Sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2o0q","text":"Click ‘Refill Sample’ – the sample cup pressure should decrease. You can see this in the software on the left hand size (include screenshot).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"didlp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3a3ae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7j3jt","text":"Sometimes the sample cup pressure doesn’t decrease and in fact increases. You can still unscrew the sample cup but if this persists there may be a blockage.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s8ur","text":"Unscrew sample cup and replace with 50ml falcon filled with 50ml 20% Decon-90 (D901-04; dilute in sterile water)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7jp0p","text":"Once securely replaced click ‘Done refill’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8upab","text":"Check ‘Sample on’ and ‘mixer on’ – Decon solution should now pass through the system; allow a 50 ml to pass through (make sure sheath is unchecked)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9k0us","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9ib8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"93ald","text":"You will get a warning about contaminating the flow cell, this normal and you can click 'Yes'","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8f7of","text":"Uncheck ‘Sample on’ or click Abort to stop sample flow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6pv62","text":"Repeat steps 13-17 with cleaning solution (Product Number: 300-5072-000; pink in colour) but only pass 10ml through the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2gicm","text":"Repeat steps 13-17 with a falcon filled with 50ml sterile water (from 4thfloor kitchen) and pass \u003e25ml through the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":71,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp77u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek018","text":"Hold an empty 50ml faclon under the sample dispenser (otherwise you will end up with a puddle of water on the COPAS!)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ap2a6","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flow check","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agfoi","text":"Allow the water to flow into the falcon tube for the full 60 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"r0ot","text":"Record volume in the COPAS logsheet (Volumes/behavgenom$/Documentation/Protocols/COPAS_wormsorter/COPAS_logs/COPAS_logbook.xlsx)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5kfnn","text":"a.Aim for flow of 25ml/minute","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3c8r6","text":"Prepare 8mL solution of 1X control particles (Product number: 310-5071-001; 2 mL 4X stock solution, 6mL sterile water; label tube with date and wrap in foil to keep in the dark) – to be prepared once per week ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3d2du","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"48jo1","text":"Set up -\u003e Control Particles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"foiau","text":"Acquire","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7qo46","text":"Adjust Sample Cup pressure so that you have 10-20 events/sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctn7","text":"Aim for TOF Cv around 10-15% and tight narrow peak for TOF and Extinction ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6lf7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ac317","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"88u64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"DE74DCB0C76F11EB9EEE05DF744365A3","height":327,"id":114491,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture 1.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr37bipyx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr35bipyx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr36bipyx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dr34bipyx.webp","width":485}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ic8e","text":"Record TOF and Extinction mean and cv in Volumes/behavgenom$/Documentation/Protocols/COPAS_wormsorter/COPAS_logs/COPAS_logbook.xlsx","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kq19","text":"Take a screenshot of the control particles screen and save into Documents/BehaviouralGenomics/ControlParticles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6a4gs","text":"a.Print Screen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1bt0g","text":"b.Open Paint","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2gln","text":"c.Ctr + v","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ejoa","text":"d.Save","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ca8hk","text":"Set up -\u003e control particles to exit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fr23f","text":"Refill sample with sterile water, run 10 mL water. You are now ready to load your sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"emqh9","text":"Refill sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"240nc","text":"Gently swirl falcon with worms and screw into sample cup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7826u","text":"Done refill","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kese","text":"Turn mixer ON. If you do not do this you may lose all your worms that have settled to the bottom of the tube!!!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g6cb","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Prime Flow Cell; to flush sample through the system and remove air bubbles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c357v","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flush sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8hqf3","text":"Check 488nm (and 568nm) laser boxes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"93r3d","text":"Check ‘Use sort gate’ for stored sort gate ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fdpk","text":"Click ‘Acquire’ – sample should pass through the system and number of events per second will be shown:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1hkr5","text":"a.Aim for 5-20 events per second","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ahhfn","text":"b.If too few/too many events increase/decrease ‘Sample cup pressure’ so that it is between 1.5-2psi","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9psod","text":"c.Gate recovery should be between 20-50% ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dng6","text":"d.To ensure only one event per droplet go to Setup-\u003eCoincidence, select ‘Pure, no double’. This increases accuracy in the number of worms dispensed but the time to dispense may increase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d7ivh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ap4fe","text":"Click on the plate icon on the top bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"mlt3","text":"Select number of objects to sort","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7n17k","text":"Select the wells you would like to fill (for testing we use a spare 60mm plate and fill wells A1, A2, B1, B2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dch5e","text":"Apply","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u7k3","text":"Place 60mm plate in front left corner of left-hand stage with A1 in the left corner.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2g0ur","text":"Click ‘Fill plate’ (the sheath will automatically turn on)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6c6mb","text":"Keep an eye on the number of events per second","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6sik0","text":"Ensure the ‘Diverter pressure’ is checked","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cljfn","text":"Check under microscope that the correct number of objects were dispensed per ‘well’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brb6p","text":"If too many objects, decrease sample cup pressure and repeat steps 8-11 or select Pure no double to increase accuracy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"59t6k","text":"Click on the plate icon on the top bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ism8","text":"‘Clear plate’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mcv","text":"Select number of objects per well and click ‘Apply to All’ or select which wells you would like to fill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d7dhm","text":"Apply","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b56bj","text":"Place 96 well plate in left-hand stage (A1 aligned)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8egts","text":"Ensure ‘Diverter pressure’ is checked’; if it is not then liquid comes out of the dispenser constantly and you get flooding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7jg5m","text":"‘Fill plate’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cu80","text":"Each time you do a dispense, save the file in the convention: YYYYMMDD_strain_ _platenumber in Documents/yourname/experimentname/date (eg. 20210211_PHX1675_S01R01)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmi3c","text":"Keep an eye on the number of events per second still and monitor how much sample fluid is coming through the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5mrl","text":"Repeat steps 13-19","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7chi1","text":"Keep sample cup with 50ml water in the falcon secured so that the system is air-tight and closed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3ntsk","text":"Empty recovery cup and waste bottle on floor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
